reviewText: This is simply one of the most effective and efficient workouts I have ever done.  This workout is challenging to be sure but provides fantastic results.Brief personal information for context: I work out between 6 to 7 times per week.  As a personal trainer I am always looking for a new challenge.  I have done many of the home workout systems that appeal to intermediate and advanced fitness levels.  I have several 100 workout DVD's and this one easily ranks as a favorite.Here is what I loved about this disc:1) All of the moves are simple to learn but challenging to perform (especially at high repetitions).2) High reps ensure that you find the "burn" - this is excellent for your heart, endurance, muscle definition and overall fitness.3) The workout is great for both men and women.4) The workout provides an awesome lower body workout and includes effective sculpting exercises with free weights for the upper body.  The glutes and legs are very large muscles; when you work these muscles you are burning a ton of calories.5) Sylwia the instructor demonstrates the moves flawlessly providing continued inspiration.This workout is ideal for anyone who wants to: improve athletic performance, improve muscle definition (especially in legs, butt and abdominals) and sculpt muscles that are often weak or soft in appearance.* Upper legs:  Adductors: inner thighs* Butt: Abductors-gluteus medius and gluteus maximus* Legs: hamstrings, quadriceps and calves* Abdominals  - lower, upper and obliquesIn addition, I have also noticed that when I perform this workout the day before a strength training day (e.g., more traditional weight lifting) that I have more endurance and power.  This might be due to the improved hormonal response that results from intense training - this type of hormonal response is beneficial to men and women for many reasons.  Whatever the reason - bonus!!I have recommended this DVD to my friends and my clients and will continue to do so.  I also love Sylwia's Mat Method - it's all on the floor and provides an awesome glute and ab burn!  I have since acquired several more of Sylwia's DVD's which I am looking forward to including into my rotation.Note:  I have been doing this workout for a few weeks and as 43 year-old male I'm ecstatic to have: found my elusive 8-pack, substantially improved my endurance, and increased the muscular definition in my glutes and legs.
summary: 10 Stars!  Best workout of its kind!

reviewText: I exercise 6 times a week, 3 days of high intensity, 2 days of medium intensity and 1 day of low intensity around 1hr to 1hr and 30 minutes a day.  I recently found Tonique's workout and I did the entire workout and I was thinking it was not so hard but I could really feel it the next day and I was having a hard time bending over, I could not exercise for the next 3 days because I was so sore it was amazing.  I really like it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have close to 300 workout DVDs, and this one is one of my absolute favorites!  The first part is mostly lunges, the second part is squats, and the final part is legwork.  Sylwia keeps you moving the entire time, and I find that I get into a zen-like flow when I do this one.Since there is very little in the way of high-impact moves, this one isn't hard on my tendonitis-prone knees.  You will work hard and break a sweat, but have fun doing so!Some people really don't like this workout, so I'd suggest watching a clip online before buying it to make sure you click with it.When I do Sylwia's workouts consistently (2-3 times a week), my legs and bum start shaping up right away. She'll tone your lower half for sure!Sylwia also has a great website with resources and rotations that use her DVDs.  She genuinely cares about helping women  get into better shape, and I love her positive attitude and encouragement!

reviewText: If you are looking for workout that is challenging and kick butt this is it. Not recommended though for someone who has knee issues because there is alot of squating done in this workout. Get ready to sweat. . . you will be sore the next day:)

reviewText: This is a great workout dvd to get if you are looking to tone, shape or sculpt your body. I have heard alot about Tonique and how well it works to shape the body, so I decided to purchase it. From the warm up it kicks you ass!! I have not been so out of breath in my life, and I am an avid workout person, and love working out as well. Tonique had me sweating within the first 5 minutes. It was amazing.When breathing is hard or you lose your breath while working out, it means you have reached the anarobic stage, and this is where those pesky fat cells burn off. Inner thighs, upper arm fat, back fat, hip fat, all those hard to lose places will get trimmed off in the anarobic zone. And Tonique Premier will put you in that zone from the very beginning.Light weights are used, and that is a good thing, help sculpt the upper body. High reps and great music and voice over.I would HIGHLY recommend this dvd for anyone who wants to get in shape quickly and wants to lose in those hard to lose areas like the inner thighs.5 stars.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love challenging myself with different types of workouts.  I have been on a barre kick lately and Tonique Premier is my latest addition.  I was surprised at how much I enjoyed this workout since I didn't likeTonique Energy Mat with Sylwia DVD.This workout is about 65 minutes long and is broken down as follows:DRILLS - 6 minutesSylwia demonstrates a series of jumping jacks and suggests you insert these drills into the workout for a bigger calorie burn.SQUATS - 17 minutesSylwia shows 10 different types of squats.  Sometimes you hold light weights and also work your arms.LUNGES - 21 minutesYou do 10 different types of lunges; sometimes holding light weights so you also work your arms.MAT WORKOUT - 15 minutesBefore starting the mat exercises, Sylwia does work to elevate the heart rate again.  You'll be doing things like mountain climbers and high knee jogs.Then it's down to the mat on all fours for some more killer leg work.  You'll also do bridge work that `kills' your glutes and hamstrings.COOL DOWN/STRETCH - 5 minutesA well deserved stretch.Here's what I really enjoyed about this workout:* It's hard, but not impossibly so.  I consider myself an advanced exerciser, but I'm fairly new to barre.* The cardio effect.  I can no longer do high impact aerobics, but I do miss that endorphin rush.  I love how this workout gets my heart rate up without impact.* The room to grow.  I was laughing, okay, I was talking back to Sylwia when she demonstrated the Drills and she said we can insert these in a few places in the workout for an extra calorie burn.  I was dying doing them once!* The compound exercises.  I like working my mind as well as my body and that's why I love compound exercises like lunges with bicep curls.* Minimal equipment, yet still a killer workout.  All you need for this workout:  good shoes, light dumbbells and a mat.* No distractions.  It's just Sylwia in a brick studio.  It's a voice over.  I found myself really focusing on Sylwia's instructions and my form.There were a few things that I didn't care for in this routine and that's why I rated it only 4 stars.Here's what I didn't like:* No warm-up.  I work out at 4:30 am and my muscles can't handle jumping right into a workout like this one.  I now do some light cardio for 10-15 minutes before starting this workout.* Sylwia's outfit in the Cool Down section couldn't be any skimpier.  I'm not a prude but her outfit bordered on indecent.* The Cool Down routine didn't seem to flow as seamlessly as the other sections.  I did like the stretches, but they really didn't flow.If you are looking for a tough workout that will help tone your body, you may just enjoy this one.
summary: A hard workout that is also fun!
